title: Overheard Conversations
subtitle: Comment on amusing or strange talks from fellow commuters.

lines.speaker: 2B2zENPfFH
lines.text: Hey Emma, you won't believe what I overheard on the train this morning.

lines.speaker: tscFH7rvti
lines.text: Oh, do tell! I love a good train story.

lines.speaker: 2B2zENPfFH
lines.text: So, there were these two guys talking about how they plan to start a 'cat yoga' class.

lines.speaker: tscFH7rvti
lines.text: Cat yoga? That's a new one. How does that even work?

lines.question: Why might commuters find talks amusing?

lines.speaker: 2B2zENPfFH
lines.text: Apparently, they think cats are natural yogis and can teach humans a thing or two about flexibility.

lines.speaker: tscFH7rvti
lines.text: I can just imagine a cat stretching and everyone trying to mimic it. That's hilarious!

lines.speaker: 2B2zENPfFH
lines.text: Right? And then one of them said they were going to market it as 'purr-fect relaxation'.

lines.speaker: tscFH7rvti
lines.text: That's so punny! I bet it would actually attract a lot of people.

lines.speaker: 2B2zENPfFH
lines.text: Yeah, and then there was this other conversation about someone who collects vintage toasters.

lines.speaker: tscFH7rvti
lines.text: Vintage toasters? That's oddly specific. What do they do with them?

lines.speaker: 2B2zENPfFH
lines.text: They said they like to restore them and display them in their kitchen as art pieces.

lines.speaker: tscFH7rvti
lines.text: I guess everyone has their own unique hobby. Toasters as art, who would've thought?

lines.speaker: 2B2zENPfFH
lines.text: Exactly! It just goes to show you never know what you'll hear on public transport.

lines.speaker: tscFH7rvti
lines.text: True. It's like a daily dose of entertainment, free of charge.

lines.speaker: 2B2zENPfFH
lines.text: Definitely! Makes the commute a bit more interesting, that's for sure.

lines.question: What did the guys plan to start?
